column5: Good to hear you finally broke the tarpon skunk Jamie
WOW...Awesome fishing trip jamie !!!!.  ...well done,great pics too...cheers

Excellent report!!! Salt water fishing is a whole other ball game. 45 minutes to catch a fish??? I think that 20 minutes is the most I would want to fight a fish. After that, its not fun anymore. Its work!lol  Must be great for the heart though! It must have been beating like a jack hammer. And the mouth is pretty thin for that size of fish. I would imagine you would have to hook it on the upper or lower lip.  Anyhoo,congrats on your first Tarpon!
the big one both Nick and I fought it it seemed like forvever... we were both done! and it swam away no worse for ware...

Well got the second batch of pics in today so here they are  Nick meets Leather man ( ironically people asked Nick for a picture because of his tan on the way home)   Tarpon I had on for a good half an hour on the bridge, beat me up good. Tail end of a good jump    lads in Key west  getting primed for our charter in Key west.. hanging out in Margatitaville  5 minutes in... tarpon on! ( ate a pinfish)  Now I am nervous as hell, I have previously hooked 6 tarpon in the last 10 years and had yet to land one  45 minutes in the fish jumps again, panick is setting in  finally in she comes  Landed! 80 pounds of pure muscle  I was so tired I could not lift the anchor. ( found enough strength to hold up a budlite though  Fish busting bait on the surface.... worst time in the world for a birds nest!  Steve catches a mack ( later shark bait)  Nick catches a nice cuda ( also shark bait)   Little blacktip  boatside blacktip  Shaynes 150 pound nurse shark

Ahhhhhh.  The Florida Keys and Key West.  Been quite a few years since I was down there.  Would love to go back some day.    I'm assuming you all did the Duval Crawl whilst you was there ?  Great report and pics CH.  Can't imagine spending 45 mins to land a single fish.
sweet
very nice!  from a kayak next year you say?!!
for sure... its in the works! had one half day in the yak there and it was great... waiting for those pics
Ya gotta love the Caribbean!!!  Great report and pics!!!
great report Jamie!
Love the report and pics Jamie.  You look so nice and warm, beauty.  Some great fish you caught there.  Hey, is that Dale Jr. on the right in the fourth photo  Joey
haha!!! I will never look at him the same...
Awesome report Jamie and luv the photo's.  Man i really got to get my tookish down they're one year and give it a shot myself. I am sooooo jealous.
next year is a new year... we had 4 this year have 12 interested next year already! its cheap, clean and the fish like to play rough
12, Blimey.....Do you all fly down or drive down?
off season... we all flew down, flights were 450 including tax round trip. 3 of the 4 guys caught the biggest fish of thier life ( I would of but I fell asleep!)
Jamie drop me a pm.......I'd like to know what roughly the total cost of the trip is.   I think i would probably drive though i love to drive and its  a good excuse to put in some sight seeing also.
THAT IS AWESOME.....looks so warm too, still like winter here.....ice has only been off the lake for 10 days.
THAT IS AWESOME.....looks so warm too, still like winter here.....ice has only been off the lake for 10 days.
Beautiful.
Jeepers....that mouth....
What an amazing report and pics!  They sure make them fish big down there....LOL.
Unreal! Great report once again Jamie!  I gotta get myself down there one day!
hmmmm,.....who knew? lol
holy crap.

Awesome report! Great memories from Key West, got engaged down there. Gotta love the main strip with all sorts cool different people mixing together. Didn't see one drunken bar fight. Had a great time at Fat Tuesday's and Jimmy Buffet does make one hell of a cheese burger. Thanks for the report Jamie.  Cheers, 1leg
to everyone that requested trip info I willt ry and get it out this evening  next trip May 08
